definition: a usually disorderly or protracted fight, struggle, or dispute
examples: Fighting there could easily draw neighboring nations into the fray.
… the patrician statesman who stood above the fray.

definition: to wear (something, such as an edge of cloth) by or as if by rubbing : fret
to separate the threads at the edge of

examples: … a botched new bus system … which has frayed tempers.

definition: to wear out or into shreds
a raveled place or worn spot (as on fabric)
